The core foundation of addiction is about not wanting to be present in your life. 

Your life is too painful of a place to be. 

Hence, you resort to becoming addicted to something. 

• Drugs
• Unhealthy Food
• Toxic Relationships
• Self-Destructive Behavior

text:
the psychology behind addictive behaviors
 • dopamine plays a key role in addiction formation
 • social media is designed to trigger addiction responses
 • stress and trauma increase addiction vulnerability
 • breaking addiction requires rewiring brain reward systems
 •

If you’re fighting addiction
1.Ask Holy Spirit for help
2.Avoid and cut off every stimulant (be drastic about it)
3.Whenever you feel the urge, take a prayer walk, worship.(when you revoke the presence of God, darkness flee)
4.Share with a trusted mentor

An addictive brain can destroy your life.

It’s killing you slowly, without you even noticing.

Luckily, Andrew Huberman has analyzed almost everything about addiction.

Here’s all you need to know (& how to get rid of your addictions) 🧵: https://t.co/VjxN8VVrYK

The real stigma in addiction is the unspoken hierarchy of what's an 'accepted' addiction and what's not. 

Drugs and alcohol aren't the only things that are addictive.

Shopping, pornography, gambling, workaholism, food, relationships: any self soothing mechanism has the

Addiction isn’t just substance use. It’s behaviors used self soothe we can’t control. Food, workaholism, pornography, shopping, and relationships can all become addictions. 

At its core addiction is avoidance.

A desire to avoid pain. And feelings of unworthiness.

This explains a lot!

🇺🇦Cocaine is an addictive drug that produces numerous psychiatric symptoms, syndromes, and disorders.
